circumstances: While approaching Grand Rapids-Gerald R. Ford Airport on a ferry flight from Baltimore, the twin engine airplane entered an uncontrolled descent and crashed in an open field located in Hastings, about 18,5 miles southeast of the destination airport. The aircraft was totally destroyed, debris scattered on a wide area and all four occupants were killed.
probable_cause:
In-flight fire or explosion on approach and subsequent uncontrolled descent after the air condition, heating and pressurization system failed. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Material failure, 
- Fire in brakes, wheel assembly and wheel well, 
- Inadequate maintenance and inspection, 
- Smoke in cockpit, 
- Pilot fatigue, 
- No log book entries for heater, Southwind model 853A, operation or required inspections/overhauls.
